   28: -module(signal_SUITE).
   29: -author('rickard.s.green@ericsson.com').
   30: 
   31: %-define(line_trace, 1).
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: -export([all/0, suite/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   34: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   35: -export([groups/0, init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   36: 
   37: % Test cases
   38: -export([xm_sig_order/1,
   39:          kill2killed/1,
   40:          contended_signal_handling/1,
   41:          dirty_signal_handling_race/1,
   42:          dirty_signal_handling_race_dirty_access/1,
   43:          dirty_signal_handling/1,
   44:          busy_dist_exit_signal/1,
   45:          busy_dist_demonitor_signal/1,
   46:          busy_dist_down_signal/1,
   47:          busy_dist_spawn_reply_signal/1,
   48:          busy_dist_unlink_ack_signal/1,
   49:          unlink_exit/1,
   50:          monitor_order/1,
   51:          monitor_named_order_local/1,
   52:          monitor_named_order_remote/1,
   53:          monitor_nodes_order/1,

   55:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv/1,
   56:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_exit/1,
   57:          move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv_exit/1,
   58:          copy_literal_area_signal_basic/1,
   59:          copy_literal_area_signal_recv/1,
   60:          copy_literal_area_signal_exit/1,
   61:          copy_literal_area_signal_recv_exit/1,
   62:          simultaneous_signals_basic/1,
   63:          simultaneous_signals_recv/1,
   64:          simultaneous_signals_exit/1,
   65:          simultaneous_signals_recv_exit/1,
   66:          parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1/1,
   67:          parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2/1,
   68:          dirty_schedule/1]).
   69: 
   70: -export([spawn_spammers/3]).
   71: 
   72: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   73:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
   74: 
   75: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   76:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   77: 
   78: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   79:     Config.
   80: 
   81: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   82:     try erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
   83:     catch  _:_ -> ok
   84:     end,
   85:     ok.
   86: 
   87: suite() ->
   88:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   89:      {timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
   90: 
   91: all() -> 
   92:     [xm_sig_order,
   93:      kill2killed,
   94:      contended_signal_handling,
   95:      dirty_signal_handling_race,
   96:      dirty_signal_handling_race_dirty_access,
   97:      dirty_signal_handling,
   98:      busy_dist_exit_signal,
   99:      busy_dist_demonitor_signal,
  100:      busy_dist_down_signal,
  101:      busy_dist_spawn_reply_signal,
  102:      busy_dist_unlink_ack_signal,
  103:      unlink_exit,
  104:      monitor_order,
  105:      monitor_named_order_local,
  106:      monitor_named_order_remote,
  107:      monitor_nodes_order,
  108:      parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1,
  109:      parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2,
  110:      dirty_schedule,
  111:      {group, adjust_message_queue}].
  112: 
  113: groups() ->
  114:     [{adjust_message_queue, [],
  115:       [move_msgs_off_heap_signal_basic,
  116:        move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv,
  117:        move_msgs_off_heap_signal_exit,
  118:        move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv_exit,
  119:        copy_literal_area_signal_basic,
  120:        copy_literal_area_signal_recv,
  121:        copy_literal_area_signal_exit,
  122:        copy_literal_area_signal_recv_exit,
  123:        simultaneous_signals_basic,
  124:        simultaneous_signals_recv,
  125:        simultaneous_signals_exit,
  126:        simultaneous_signals_recv_exit]}].
  127: 
  128: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  129:     Config.
  130: 
  131: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  132:     Config.
  133: 
  134: %% Test that exit signals and messages are received in correct order
  135: xm_sig_order(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  136:     LNode = node(),
  137:     repeat(fun (_) -> xm_sig_order_test(LNode) end, 1000),
  138:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  139:     repeat(fun (_) -> xm_sig_order_test(RNode) end, 1000),
  140:     peer:stop(Peer),
  141:     ok.
  142: 
  143: xm_sig_order_test(Node) ->
  144:     P = spawn(Node, fun () -> xm_sig_order_proc() end),
  145:     M = erlang:monitor(process, P),
  146:     P ! may_reach,
  147:     P ! may_reach,
  148:     P ! may_reach,
  149:     exit(P, good_signal_order),
  150:     P ! may_not_reach,
  151:     P ! may_not_reach,
  152:     P ! may_not_reach,
  153:     receive
  154: 	      {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
  155: 		  good_signal_order = R
  156: 	  end.
  157: 
  158: xm_sig_order_proc() ->
  159:     receive
  160: 	may_not_reach -> exit(bad_signal_order);
  161: 	may_reach -> ok
  162:     after 0 -> erlang:yield()
  163:     end,
  164:     xm_sig_order_proc().
  165: 
  166: kill2killed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  167:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  168:     kill2killed_test(node()),
  169:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  170:     kill2killed_test(Node),
  171:     peer:stop(Peer).
  172: 
  173: kill2killed_test(Node) ->
  174:     if Node == node() ->
  175:             io:format("Testing against local node", []);
  176:        true ->
  177:             io:format("Testing against remote node ~p", [Node])
  178:     end,
  179:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 1),
  180:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 2),
  181:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 9),
  182:     check_exit(Node, other_exit2, 10),
  183:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 1),
  184:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 2),
  185:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 9),
  186:     check_exit(Node, exit2, 10),
  187:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 1),
  188:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 2),
  189:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 9),
  190:     check_exit(Node, exit1, 10),
  191:     ok.
  192: 
  193: check_exit(Node, Type, N) ->
  194:     io:format("Testing ~p length ~p~n", [Type, N]),
  195:     P = spawn_link_line(Node, node(), Type, N, self()),
  196:     if Type == other_exit2 ->
  197:             receive
  198:                 {end_of_line, EOL} ->
  199:                     exit(EOL, kill)
  200:             end;
  201:        true -> ok
  202:     end,
  203:     receive
  204:         {'EXIT', P, Reason} ->
  205:             if Type == exit1 ->
  206:                     kill = Reason;
  207:                true ->
  208:                     killed = Reason
  209:             end
  210:     end.
  211: 
  212: spawn_link_line(_NodeA, _NodeB, other_exit2, 0, Tester) ->
  213:     Tester ! {end_of_line, self()},
  214:     receive after infinity -> ok end;
  215: spawn_link_line(_NodeA, _NodeB, exit1, 0, _Tester) ->
  216:     exit(kill);
  217: spawn_link_line(_NodeA, _NodeB, exit2, 0, _Tester) ->
  218:     exit(self(), kill);
  219: spawn_link_line(NodeA, NodeB, Type, N, Tester) ->
  220:     spawn_link(NodeA,
  221:                fun () ->
  222:                        spawn_link_line(NodeB, NodeA, Type, N-1, Tester),
  223:                        receive after infinity -> ok end
  224:                end).
  225: 
  226: contended_signal_handling(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  227:     %%
  228:     %% Test for a race in signal handling of a process.
  229:     %%
  230:     %% When executing dirty, a "dirty signal handler"
  231:     %% process will handle signals for the process. If
  232:     %% the process stops executing dirty while the dirty
  233:     %% signal handler process is handling signals on
  234:     %% behalf of the process, both the dirty signal handler
  235:     %% process and the process itself might try to handle
  236:     %% signals for the process at the same time. There used
  237:     %% to be a bug that caused both processes to enter the
  238:     %% signal handling code simultaneously when the main
  239:     %% lock of the process was temporarily released during
  240:     %% signal handling (see GH-4885/OTP-17462/PR-4914).
  241:     %% Currently the main lock is only released when the
  242:     %% process receives an 'unlock' signal from a port,
  243:     %% and then responds by sending an 'unlock-ack' signal
  244:     %% to the port. This testcase tries to massage that
  245:     %% scenario. It is quite hard to cause a crash even
  246:     %% when the bug exists, but this testcase at least
  247:     %% sometimes causes a crash when the bug is present.
  248:     %%
  249:     move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler(),
  250:     process_flag(priority, high),
  251:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  252:         1 ->
  253:             ok;
  254:         SOnln -> 
  255:             process_flag(scheduler, SOnln),
  256:             ok
  257:     end,
  258:     Drv = unlink_signal_drv,
  259:     ok = load_driver(Config, Drv),
  260:     try
  261:         contended_signal_handling_test(Drv, 250)
  262:     after
  263:         ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
  264:     end,
  265:     ok.
  266: 
  267: contended_signal_handling_test(_Drv, 0) ->
  268:     ok;
  269: contended_signal_handling_test(Drv, N) ->
  270:     Ports = contended_signal_handling_make_ports(Drv, 100, []),
  271:     erlang:yield(),
  272:     contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports(Ports),
  273:     erts_debug:dirty_cpu(wait, rand:uniform(5)),
  274:     wait_until(fun () -> Ports == Ports -- erlang:ports() end),
  275:     contended_signal_handling_test(Drv, N-1).
  276: 
  277: contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports([]) ->
  278:     ok;
  279: contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports([P|Ps]) ->
  280:     P ! {self(), {command, "c"}},
  281:     contended_signal_handling_cmd_ports(Ps).
  282: 
  283: contended_signal_handling_make_ports(_Drv, 0, Ports) ->
  284:     Ports;
  285: contended_signal_handling_make_ports(Drv, N, Ports) ->
  286:     Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, []),
  287:     true = is_port(Port),
  288:     contended_signal_handling_make_ports(Drv, N-1, [Port|Ports]).
  289: 
  290: dirty_signal_handling_race(Config) ->
  291:     %% This test case trigger more or less the same
  292:     %% problematic scenario as the contended_signal_handling
  293:     %% test case is trying to trigger. This test case triggers
  294:     %% it via another signal and is also much more likely
  295:     %% (close to 100%) to trigger the problematic schenario.
  296:     Tester = self(),
  297:     move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler(),
  298:     {S0, S1} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  299:                    1 -> {1, 1};
  300:                    2 -> {2, 1};
  301:                    SOnln -> {SOnln, SOnln-1}
  302:                end,
  303:     process_flag(priority, high),
  304:     process_flag(scheduler, S0),
  305:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  306:     Drv = unlink_signal_drv,
  307:     ok = load_driver(Config, Drv),
  308:     try
  309:         %% {parallelism, true} option will ensure that each
  310:         %% signal to the port from a process is scheduled which
  311:         %% forces the process to release its main lock when
  312:         %% sending the signal...
  313:         Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, [{parallelism, true}]),
  314:         true = is_port(Port),
  315:         %% The {alias, reply_demonitor} option will trigger a
  316:         %% 'demonitor' signal from Tester to the port when an
  317:         %% alias message sent using the alias is received by
  318:         %% Tester...
  319:         MA1 = erlang:monitor(port, Port, [{alias, reply_demonitor}]),
  320:         MA2 = erlang:monitor(port, Port, [{alias, reply_demonitor}]),
  321:         Pid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  322:                                 Tester ! go,
  323:                                 receive after 500 -> ok end,
  324:                                 %% The 'proc_sig_block' test signal will cause
  325:                                 %% dirty signal handling to start and be
  326:                                 %% blocked in the signal handling.
  327:                                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  328:                                                               {Tester, 1000}),
  329:                                 %% Tester will be stuck waiting for main lock
  330:                                 %% when being scheduled out from its dirty
  331:                                 %% execution. When this alias message is
  332:                                 %% by the dirty signal handler Tester will be
  333:                                 %% able to aquire the main lock and complete
  334:                                 %% the schedule out operation.
  335:                                 MA1 ! {MA1, trigger_demonitor_port_please},
  336:                                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  337:                                                               {Tester, 100}),
  338:                                 %% Tester will have been selected for
  339:                                 %% execution, but stuck waiting for main lock.
  340:                                 %% When this alias message is handled by the
  341:                                 %% dirty signal handler, Tester will be able
  342:                                 %% to aquire the main lock which will let it
  343:                                 %% enter the problematic scenario. That is,
  344:                                 %% ongoing dirty signal handling while it
  345:                                 %% begins executing.
  346:                                 MA2 ! {MA2, trigger_demonitor_port_please},
  347:                                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  348:                                                               {Tester, 500}),
  349:                                 ok
  350:                         end, [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
  351:         receive go -> ok end,
  352:         receive {'DOWN', MA1, port, Port, _} -> ct:fail(unexpected_port_down)
  353:         after 0 -> ok
  354:         end,
  355:         receive {'DOWN', MA2, port, Port, _} -> ct:fail(unexpected_port_down)
  356:         after 0 -> ok
  357:         end,
  358:         erts_debug:dirty_cpu(wait, 1000),
  359:         receive
  360:             {MA1, trigger_demonitor_port_please} -> ok
  361:         end,
  362:         receive
  363:             {MA2, trigger_demonitor_port_please} -> ok
  364:         end,
  365:         unlink(Pid),
  366:         unlink(Port),
  367:         exit(Pid, kill),
  368:         exit(Port, kill),
  369:         false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid)
  370:     after
  371:         ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
  372:     end,
  373:     ok.
  374: 
  375: dirty_signal_handling_race_dirty_access(Config) ->
  376:     %% This test case trigger more or less the same
  377:     %% problematic scenario as the contended_signal_handling
  378:     %% and dirty_signal_handling_race, but when a dirty
  379:     %% scheduler access the signal queue.
  380:     dirty_signal_handling_race_dirty_access_test(Config).
  381: 
  382: dirty_signal_handling_race_dirty_access_test(Config) ->
  383:     Tester = self(),
  384:     move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler(),
  385:     {S0, S1} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  386:                    1 -> {1, 1};
  387:                    2 -> {2, 1};
  388:                    SOnln -> {SOnln, SOnln-1}
  389:                end,
  390:     process_flag(priority, high),
  391:     process_flag(scheduler, S0),
  392:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  393:     Drv = unlink_signal_drv,
  394:     ok = load_driver(Config, Drv),
  395:     DCpuOnln = erlang:system_flag(dirty_cpu_schedulers_online, 1),
  396:     try
  397:         _ = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 0),
  398:         Data = lists:seq(1, 1000000),
  399:         %% {parallelism, true} option will ensure that each
  400:         %% signal to the port from a process is scheduled which
  401:         %% forces the process to release its main lock when
  402:         %% sending the signal...
  403:         Port = open_port({spawn, Drv}, [{parallelism, true}]),
  404:         true = is_port(Port),
  405:         %% The {alias, reply_demonitor} option will trigger a
  406:         %% 'demonitor' signal from Tester to the port when an
  407:         %% alias message sent using the alias is received by
  408:         %% Tester...
  409:         MA1 = erlang:monitor(port, Port, [{alias, reply_demonitor}]),
  410:         P0 = spawn_link(fun () ->
  411:                                 erlang:yield(),
  412:                                 Tester ! {self(), going_dirty},
  413:                                 erts_debug:dirty_cpu(wait, 1000)
  414:                         end),
  415:         receive {P0, going_dirty} -> ok end,
  416:         P1 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  417:                                receive after 500 -> ok end,
  418:                                %% The 'proc_sig_block' test signal will cause
  419:                                %% dirty signal handling to start and be
  420:                                %% blocked in the signal handling.
  421:                                erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_block,
  422:                                                              {Tester, 1000}),
  423:                                %% Tester will be stuck waiting for main lock
  424:                                %% when being scheduled in for dirty GC. When
  425:                                %% the following alias message is handled by
  426:                                %% the dirty signal handler Tester will be
  427:                                %% able to aquire the main lock and begin
  428:                                %% execution while the dirt signal handler
  429:                                %% still is not finnished.
  430:                                MA1 ! {MA1, trigger_demonitor_port_please},
  431:                                ok
  432:                        end, [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
  433:         receive after 250 -> ok end,
  434:         %% Do a GC. It will be performed on a dirty scheduler due to
  435:         %% the amount of data on the heap. Since we only got one dirty
  436:         %% cpu scheduler online, we will be stuck in dirty cpu runq until
  437:         %% P0 is done
  438:         garbage_collect(), %% Dirty GC due to Data
  439:         receive
  440:             {'DOWN', MA1, port, Port, _} -> ct:fail(unexpected_port_down);
  441:             {MA1, trigger_demonitor_port_please} -> ok
  442:         end,
  443:         unlink(P1),
  444:         unlink(Port),
  445:         exit(P0, kill),
  446:         exit(P1, kill),
  447:         exit(Port, kill),
  448:         false = erlang:is_process_alive(P0),
  449:         false = erlang:is_process_alive(P1),
  450:         _ = id(Data)
  451:     after
  452:         erlang:system_flag(dirty_cpu_schedulers_online, DCpuOnln),
  453:         ok = erl_ddll:unload_driver(Drv)
  454:     end,
  455:     ok.
  456: 
  457: move_dirty_signal_handlers_to_first_scheduler() ->
  458:     SOnln = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
  459:     try
  460:         true = lists:foldl(
  461:                  fun (Pid, FoundOne) ->
  462:                          case process_info(Pid, initial_call) of
  463:                              {initial_call, {erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}} ->
  464:                                  Pid ! please_execute_a_bit,
  465:                                  true;
  466:                              _ ->
  467:                                  FoundOne
  468:                          end
  469:                  end,
  470:                  false,
  471:                  processes())
  472:     after
  473:         erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SOnln)
  474:     end,
  475:     ok.
  476: 
  477: dirty_signal_handling(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  478:     %%
  479:     %% PR-7822 (third commit)
  480:     %%
  481:     %% Make sure signals are handled regardless of whether a process is
  482:     %% executing dirty or is scheduled for dirty execution...
  483: 
  484:     %% Make sure all dirty I/O schedulers are occupied with work...
  485:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  486:                            spawn(fun () ->
  487:                                          erts_debug:dirty_io(wait, 1000)
  488:                                  end)
  489:                    end, lists:seq(1, erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers))),
  490:     %% P ends up in the run queue waiting for a free dirty I/O scheduler...
  491:     P = spawn(fun () ->
  492:                       erts_debug:dirty_io(wait, 1000)
  493:               end),
  494:     receive after 300 -> ok end,
  495:     %% current_function is added to prevent read of status from being optimized
  496:     %% to read status directly...
  497:     [{status,runnable},{current_function, _}] = process_info(P, [status,current_function]),
  498:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  499:     [{status,running},{current_function, _}] = process_info(P, [status,current_function]),
  500:     lists:foreach(fun (X) -> exit(X, kill) end, [P|Ps]),
  501:     lists:foreach(fun (X) -> false = is_process_alive(X) end, [P|Ps]),
  502:     ok.
  503: 
  504: busy_dist_exit_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  505:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  506: 
  507:     BusyTime = 1000,
  508:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  509:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  510:     Tester = self(),
  511:     {Exiter,MRef} = spawn_monitor(BusyChannelNode,
  512:                                   fun () ->
  513:                                           pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  514:                                           Tester ! {self(), alive},
  515:                                           receive after infinity -> ok end
  516:                                   end),
  517:     receive
  518:         {Exiter, alive} ->
  519:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]);
  520:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Why, normal} ->
  521:             ct:fail({exiter_died, Why})
  522:     end,
  523:     Linker = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  524:                         fun () ->
  525:                                 process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  526:                                 link(Exiter),
  527:                                 receive
  528:                                     {'EXIT', Exiter, Reason} ->
  529:                                         tester_killed_me = Reason,
  530:                                         Tester ! {self(), got_exiter_exit_message};
  531:                                     Unexpected ->
  532:                                         exit({unexpected_message, Unexpected})
  533:                                 end
  534:                          end),
  535:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  536:     exit(Exiter, tester_killed_me),
  537:     receive
  538:         {Linker, got_exiter_exit_message} ->
  539:             unlink(Linker),
  540:             ok
  541:     after
  542:         BusyTime*2 ->
  543:             ct:fail(missing_exit_signal)
  544:     end,
  545:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  546:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  547:     ok.
  548: 
  549: busy_dist_demonitor_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  550:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  551: 
  552:     BusyTime = 1000,
  553:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  554:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  555:     Tester = self(),
  556:     Demonitorer = spawn(BusyChannelNode,
  557:                         fun () ->
  558:                                 pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  559:                                 Tester ! {self(), alive},
  560:                                 receive
  561:                                     {Tester, monitor, Pid} ->
  562:                                         _Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid)
  563:                                 end,
  564:                                 receive after infinity -> ok end
  565:                         end),
  566:     receive {Demonitorer, alive} -> ok end,
  567:     Demonitoree = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  568:                              fun () ->
  569:                                      wait_until(fun () ->
  570:                                                         {monitored_by, MB1}
  571:                                                             = process_info(self(),
  572:                                                                            monitored_by),
  573:                                                         lists:member(Demonitorer, MB1)
  574:                                                 end),
  575:                                      Tester ! {self(), monitored},
  576:                                      wait_until(fun () ->
  577:                                                         {monitored_by, MB2}
  578:                                                             = process_info(self(),
  579:                                                                            monitored_by),
  580:                                                         not lists:member(Demonitorer, MB2)
  581:                                                 end),
  582:                                      Tester ! {self(), got_demonitorer_demonitor_signal}
  583:                              end),
  584:     Demonitorer ! {self(), monitor, Demonitoree},
  585:     receive {Demonitoree, monitored} -> ok end,
  586:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  587:     exit(Demonitorer, tester_killed_me),
  588:     receive
  589:         {Demonitoree, got_demonitorer_demonitor_signal} ->
  590:             unlink(Demonitoree),
  591:             ok
  592:     after
  593:         BusyTime*2 ->
  594:             ct:fail(missing_demonitor_signal)
  595:     end,
  596:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  597:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  598:     ok.
  599: 
  600: busy_dist_down_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  601:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  602: 
  603:     BusyTime = 1000,
  604:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  605:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  606:     Tester = self(),
  607:     {Exiter,MRef} = spawn_monitor(BusyChannelNode,
  608:                                   fun () ->
  609:                                           pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  610:                                           Tester ! {self(), alive},
  611:                                           receive after infinity -> ok end
  612:                                   end),
  613:     receive
  614:         {Exiter, alive} ->
  615:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]);
  616:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Why, normal} ->
  617:             ct:fail({exiter_died, Why})
  618:     end,
  619:     Monitorer = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  620:                         fun () ->
  621:                                 process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  622:                                 Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Exiter),
  623:                                 receive
  624:                                     {'DOWN', Mon, process, Exiter, Reason} ->
  625:                                         tester_killed_me = Reason,
  626:                                         Tester ! {self(), got_exiter_down_message};
  627:                                     Unexpected ->
  628:                                         exit({unexpected_message, Unexpected})
  629:                                 end
  630:                          end),
  631:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  632:     exit(Exiter, tester_killed_me),
  633:     receive
  634:         {Monitorer, got_exiter_down_message} ->
  635:             unlink(Monitorer),
  636:             ok
  637:     after
  638:         BusyTime*2 ->
  639:             ct:fail(missing_down_signal)
  640:     end,
  641:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  642:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  643:     ok.
  644: 
  645: busy_dist_spawn_reply_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  646:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  647: 
  648:     BusyTime = 1000,
  649:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  650:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  651:     Tester = self(),
  652:     Spawner = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  653:                          fun () ->
  654:                                  pong = net_adm:ping(BusyChannelNode),
  655:                                  Tester ! {self(), ready},
  656:                                  receive {Tester, go} -> ok end,
  657:                                  ReqID = spawn_request(BusyChannelNode,
  658:                                                        fun () -> ok end,
  659:                                                        []),
  660:                                  receive
  661:                                      {spawn_reply, ReqID, Result, _Pid} ->
  662:                                          ok = Result,
  663:                                          Tester ! {self(), got_spawn_reply_message};
  664:                                      Unexpected ->
  665:                                          exit({unexpected_message, Unexpected})
  666:                                  end
  667:                          end),
  668:     receive {Spawner, ready} -> ok end,
  669:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  670:     Spawner ! {self(), go},
  671:     receive
  672:         {Spawner, got_spawn_reply_message} ->
  673:             unlink(Spawner),
  674:             ok
  675:     after
  676:         BusyTime*2 ->
  677:             ct:fail(missing_spawn_reply_signal)
  678:     end,
  679:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  680:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  681:     ok.
  682: 
  683: -record(erl_link, {type,           % process | port | dist_process
  684:                    pid = [],
  685:                    state,          % linked | unlinking
  686:                    id}).
  687: 
  688: busy_dist_unlink_ack_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  689:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  690: 
  691:     BusyTime = 1000,
  692:     {ok, BusyChannelPeer, BusyChannelNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  693:     {ok, OtherPeer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-proto_dist", "gen_tcp"]),
  694:     Tester = self(),
  695:     {Unlinkee,MRef} = spawn_monitor(BusyChannelNode,
  696:                                     fun () ->
  697:                                             pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode),
  698:                                             Tester ! {self(), alive},
  699:                                             receive after infinity -> ok end
  700:                                     end),
  701:     receive
  702:         {Unlinkee, alive} ->
  703:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]);
  704:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Why, normal} ->
  705:             ct:fail({unlinkee_died, Why})
  706:     end,
  707:     Unlinker = spawn_link(OtherNode,
  708:                           fun () ->
  709:                                   erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  710:                                   link(Unlinkee),
  711:                                   #erl_link{type = dist_process,
  712:                                             pid = Unlinkee,
  713:                                             state = linked} = find_proc_link(self(),
  714:                                                                              Unlinkee),
  715:                                   Tester ! {self(), ready},
  716:                                   receive {Tester, go} -> ok end,
  717:                                   unlink(Unlinkee),
  718:                                   #erl_link{type = dist_process,
  719:                                             pid = Unlinkee,
  720:                                             state = unlinking} = find_proc_link(self(),
  721:                                                                                 Unlinkee),
  722:                                   wait_until(fun () ->
  723:                                                      false == find_proc_link(self(),
  724:                                                                              Unlinkee)
  725:                                              end),
  726:                                   Tester ! {self(), got_unlink_ack_signal}
  727:                           end),
  728:     receive {Unlinker, ready} -> ok end,
  729:     make_busy(BusyChannelNode, OtherNode, BusyTime),
  730:     Unlinker ! {self(), go},
  731:     receive
  732:         {Unlinker, got_unlink_ack_signal} ->
  733:             unlink(Unlinker),
  734:             ok
  735:     after
  736:         BusyTime*2 ->
  737:             ct:fail(missing_unlink_ack_signal)
  738:     end,
  739:     peer:stop(BusyChannelPeer),
  740:     peer:stop(OtherPeer),
  741:     ok.
  742: 
  743: unlink_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  744:     %% OTP-18177
  745:     %%
  746:     %% This bug is theoretically possible, at least in the
  747:     %% node local scenario, but more or less undetectable and
  748:     %% quite harmless when it hits. A process A (the child in
  749:     %% the testcase) could get actual exit reason of another
  750:     %% process B (the parent in the testcase) when it should
  751:     %% have gotten 'noproc' as exit reason. This can happen if
  752:     %% 1. B unlinks A
  753:     %% 2. B begin terminating before it has received an unlink
  754:     %%    ack from A
  755:     %% 3. A links to B after it has received the unlink signal
  756:     %%
  757:     %% This testcase hammers on the above scenario, but I have
  758:     %% not seen it fail yet though when the bug is present...
  759:     repeat(fun unlink_exit_test/0, 1000).
  760: 
  761: unlink_exit_test() ->
  762:     Tester = self(),
  763:     ChildFun =
  764:         fun () ->
  765:                 process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  766:                 Tester ! {child, self()},
  767:                 Parent = receive {tester_parent, Tester, Pid} -> Pid end,
  768:                 Parent ! {go, self()},
  769:                 busy_wait_until(fun () ->
  770:                                         receive {go, Parent} -> true
  771:                                         after 0 -> false
  772:                                         end
  773:                                 end),
  774:                 IsAlive = erlang:is_process_alive(Parent),
  775:                 try
  776:                     link(Parent),
  777:                     case IsAlive of
  778:                         false ->
  779:                             receive
  780:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, noproc} ->
  781:                                     exit(ok);
  782:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, R1} ->
  783:                                     exit({not_alive_unexpected_exit_reason, R1})
  784:                             after 1000 ->
  785:                                     exit(not_alive_missing_exit)
  786:                             end;
  787:                         true ->
  788:                             receive
  789:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, R2} when R2 == noproc;
  790:                                                           R2 == bye ->
  791:                                     exit(ok);
  792:                                 {'EXIT', Parent, R2} ->
  793:                                     exit({alive_unexpected_exit_reason, R2})
  794:                             after 1000 ->
  795:                                     exit(alive_missing_exit)
  796:                             end
  797:                     end
  798:                 catch error:noproc ->
  799:                         receive
  800:                             {'EXIT', Parent, _} = X0 ->
  801:                                 exit({unexpected_exit, X0})
  802:                         after 1000 ->
  803:                                 exit(ok)
  804:                         end
  805:                 end
  806:         end,
  807:     {Parent, PMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  808:                                        %% Work to do when terminating in order
  809:                                        %% to increase the likelyhood of the
  810:                                        %% bug triggering (if present)...
  811:                                        T = ets:new(x,[]),
  812:                                        ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
  813:                                                                        {I,I}
  814:                                                                end,
  815:                                                                lists:seq(1,10000))),
  816: 
  817:                                        Child = spawn_opt(ChildFun,
  818:                                                          [{priority, high},
  819:                                                           link]),
  820:                                        receive {go, Child} -> ok end,
  821:                                        unlink(Child),
  822:                                        Child ! {go, self()},
  823:                                        exit(bye)
  824:                                end, [{priority, high}, monitor]),
  825:     Child = receive {child, Chld} -> Chld end,
  826:     CMon = erlang:monitor(process, Child),
  827:     Child ! {tester_parent, Tester, Parent},
  828:     receive
  829:         {'DOWN', PMon, process, Parent, bye} ->
  830:             ok
  831:     end,
  832:     receive
  833:         {'DOWN', CMon, process, Child, ok} ->
  834:             ok;
  835:         {'DOWN', CMon, process, Child, ChildReason} ->
  836:             ct:fail(ChildReason)
  837:     end.
  838: 
  839: %% Monitors could be reordered relative to message signals when the parallel
  840: %% signal sending optimization was active.
  841: monitor_order(_Config) ->
  842:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  843:     monitor_order_1(10).
  844: 
  845: monitor_order_1(0) ->
  846:     ok;
  847: monitor_order_1(N) ->
  848:     Self = self(),
  849:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  850:                                         receive
  851:                                             MRef ->
  852:                                                 %% The first message sets up
  853:                                                 %% the parallel signal buffer,
  854:                                                 %% the second uses it.
  855:                                                 Self ! {self(), MRef, first},
  856:                                                 Self ! {self(), MRef, second}
  857:                                         end,
  858:                                         exit(normal)
  859:                                 end),
  860:     Pid ! MRef,
  861:     receive
  862:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, normal} ->
  863:             ct:fail("Down signal arrived before second message!");
  864:         {Pid, MRef, second} ->
  865:             receive {Pid, MRef, first} -> ok end,
  866:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
  867:             monitor_order_1(N - 1)
  868:     end.
  869: 
  870: %% Signal order: Message vs DOWN from local process monitored by name.
  871: monitor_named_order_local(_Config) ->
  872:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  873:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  874:     true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers, true),
  875: 
  876:     LNode = node(),
  877:     repeat(fun (N) -> monitor_named_order(LNode, N) end, 100),
  878:     ok.
  879: 
  880: %% Signal order: Message vs DOWN from remote process monitored by name.
  881: monitor_named_order_remote(_Config) ->
  882:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  883:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  884:     true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers, true),
  885: 
  886:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  887:     repeat(fun (N) -> monitor_named_order(RNode, N) end, 10),
  888:     peer:stop(Peer),
  889:     ok.
  890: 
  891: monitor_named_order(Node, N) ->
  892:     %% Send messages using pid, name and alias.
  893:     Pid = self(),
  894:     register(tester, Pid),
  895:     Name = {tester, node()},
  896:     AliasA = alias(),
  897:     NumMsg = 1000 + N,
  898:     Sender = spawn_link(Node,
  899:                      fun() ->
  900:                              register(monitor_named_order, self()),
  901:                              Pid ! {self(), ready},
  902:                              {go, AliasM} = receive_any(),
  903:                              send_msg_seq(Pid, Name, AliasA, AliasM, NumMsg),
  904:                              exit(normal)
  905:                      end),
  906:     {Sender, ready} = receive_any(),
  907:     AliasM = monitor(process, {monitor_named_order,Node},
  908:                      [{alias,explicit_unalias}]),
  909:     Sender ! {go, AliasM},
  910:     recv_msg_seq(NumMsg),
  911:     {'DOWN', AliasM, process, {monitor_named_order,Node}, normal}
  912:         = receive_any(),
  913:     unregister(tester),
  914:     unalias(AliasA),
  915:     unalias(AliasM),
  916:     ok.
  917: 
  918: send_msg_seq(_, _, _, _, 0) -> ok;
  919: send_msg_seq(To1, To2, To3, To4, N) ->
  920:     To1 ! N,
  921:     send_msg_seq(To2, To3, To4, To1, N-1).
  922: 
  923: recv_msg_seq(0) -> ok;
  924: recv_msg_seq(N) ->
  925:     N = receive M -> M end,
  926:     recv_msg_seq(N-1).
  927: 
  928: receive_any() ->
  929:     receive M -> M end.
  930: 
  931: receive_any(Timeout) ->
  932:     receive M -> M
  933:     after Timeout -> timeout
  934:     end.
  935: 
  936: monitor_nodes_order(_Config) ->
  937:     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  938:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  939:     true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers, true),
  940: 
  941:     {ok, Peer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{peer_down => continue,
  942:                                    connection => 0}),
  943:     Self = self(),
  944:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [nodedown_reason]),
  945:     [] = nodes(connected),
  946:     Pids = peer:call(Peer, ?MODULE, spawn_spammers, [64, Self, []]),
  947:     {nodeup, RNode, []} = receive_any(),
  948: 
  949:     ok = peer:cast(Peer, erlang, halt, [0]),
  950: 
  951:     [put(P, 0) || P <- Pids],  % spam counters per sender
  952:     {nodedown, RNode, [{nodedown_reason,connection_closed}]} =
  953:         receive_filter_spam(),
  954:     [io:format("From spammer ~p: ~p messages\n", [P, get(P)]) || P <- Pids],
  955:     timeout = receive_any(100),   % Nothing after nodedown
  956: 
  957:     {down, tcp_closed} = peer:get_state(Peer),
  958:     peer:stop(Peer),
  959:     ok.
  960: 
  961: spawn_spammers(0, _To, Acc) ->
  962:     Acc;
  963: spawn_spammers(N, To, Acc) ->
  964:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> spam_pid(To, 1) end),
  965:     spawn_spammers(N-1, To, [Pid | Acc]).
  966: 
  967: spam_pid(To, N) ->
  968:     To ! {spam, self(), N},
  969:     erlang:yield(), % Let other spammers run to get lots of different senders
  970:     spam_pid(To, N+1).
  971: 
  972: receive_filter_spam() ->
  973:     receive
  974:         {spam, From, N} ->
  975:             match(N, get(From) + 1),
  976:             put(From, N),
  977:             receive_filter_spam();
  978:         M -> M
  979:     end.
  980: 
  981: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  982:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(false, false).
  983: 
  984: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  985:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(true, false).
  986: 
  987: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  988:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(false, true).
  989: 
  990: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_recv_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  991:     move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(true, true).
  992: 
  993: move_msgs_off_heap_signal_test(RecvPair, Exit) ->
  994:     erlang:trace(new_processes, true, [running_procs]),
  995:     SFact = test_server:timetrap_scale_factor(),
  996:     GoTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 1000*SFact,
  997:     ProcF = fun () ->
  998:                     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  999:                     Tmo = case GoTime - Now of
 1000:                               Left when Left < 0 ->
 1001:                                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
 1002:                                   0;
 1003:                               Left ->
 1004:                                   Left
 1005:                           end,
 1006:                     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
 1007:                     on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1008:                     if RecvPair -> receive_integer_pairs(infinity);
 1009:                        true -> receive after infinity -> ok end
 1010:                     end
 1011:             end,
 1012:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1013:                            spawn_opt(ProcF,
 1014:                                      [link,
 1015:                                       {message_queue_data, on_heap}])
 1016:                    end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 1017:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1018:                           lists:foreach(fun (N) when N rem 100 == 0 ->
 1019:                                                 P ! [N|N];
 1020:                                             (N) ->
 1021:                                                 P ! N
 1022:                                         end, lists:seq(1, 10000))
 1023:                   end, Ps),
 1024:     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1025:     Tmo = case GoTime - Now + 10 of
 1026:               Left when Left < 0 ->
 1027:                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
 1028:                   0;
 1029:               Left ->
 1030:                   Left
 1031:           end,
 1032:     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
 1033:     if Exit ->
 1034:             _ = lists:foldl(fun (P, N) when N rem 10 ->
 1035:                                     unlink(P),
 1036:                                     exit(P, terminated),
 1037:                                     N+1;
 1038:                                 (_P, N) ->
 1039:                                     N+1
 1040:                             end,
 1041:                             0,
 1042:                             Ps),
 1043:             ok;
 1044:        true ->
 1045:             ok
 1046:     end,
 1047:     wait_traced_not_running(1000 + 200*SFact),
 1048:     erlang:trace(new_processes, false, [running_procs]),
 1049:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1050:                           unlink(P),
 1051:                           exit(P, kill)
 1052:                   end, Ps),
 1053:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1054:                           false = is_process_alive(P)
 1055:                   end, Ps),
 1056:     ok.
 1057: 
 1058: copy_literal_area_signal_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1059:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(false, false).
 1060: 
 1061: copy_literal_area_signal_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1062:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(true, false).
 1063: 
 1064: copy_literal_area_signal_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1065:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(false, true).
 1066: 
 1067: copy_literal_area_signal_recv_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1068:     copy_literal_area_signal_test(true, true).
 1069: 
 1070: copy_literal_area_signal_test(RecvPair, Exit) ->
 1071:     persistent_term:put({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}, make_ref()),
 1072:     Literal = persistent_term:get({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
 1073:     true = is_reference(Literal),
 1074:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
 1075:     ProcF = fun () ->
 1076:                     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
 1077:                     if RecvPair ->
 1078:                             receive receive_pairs -> ok end,
 1079:                             receive_integer_pairs(0);
 1080:                        true ->
 1081:                             ok
 1082:                     end,
 1083:                     receive check_literal_conversion -> ok end,
 1084:                     receive
 1085:                         Literal ->
 1086:                             %% Should not be a literal anymore...
 1087:                             false = (0 == erts_debug:size_shared(Literal))
 1088:                     end
 1089:             end,
 1090:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1091:                             spawn_opt(ProcF, [link, monitor])
 1092:                     end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 1093:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1094:                           lists:foreach(fun (N) when N rem 100 == 0 ->
 1095:                                                 P ! [N|N];
 1096:                                             (N) ->
 1097:                                                 P ! N
 1098:                                         end, lists:seq(1, 10000)),
 1099:                           P ! Literal
 1100:                   end, PMs),
 1101:     persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
 1102:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1103:     if RecvPair ->
 1104:             lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1105:                                   P ! receive_pairs
 1106:                           end, PMs);
 1107:        true ->
 1108:             ok
 1109:     end,
 1110:     if Exit ->
 1111:             _ = lists:foldl(fun ({P, _M}, N) when N rem 10 ->
 1112:                                     unlink(P),
 1113:                                     exit(P, terminated),
 1114:                                     N+1;
 1115:                                 (_PM, N) ->
 1116:                                     N+1
 1117:                             end,
 1118:                             0,
 1119:                             PMs),
 1120:             ok;
 1121:        true ->
 1122:             ok
 1123:     end,
 1124:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(),
 1125:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1126:                           P ! check_literal_conversion
 1127:                   end, PMs),
 1128:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1129:                           receive
 1130:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
 1131:                                   case R of
 1132:                                       normal -> ok;
 1133:                                       terminated -> ok
 1134:                                   end
 1135:                           end
 1136:                   end, PMs),
 1137:     ok.
 1138: 
 1139: simultaneous_signals_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1140:     simultaneous_signals_test(false, false).
 1141: 
 1142: simultaneous_signals_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1143:     simultaneous_signals_test(true, false).
 1144: 
 1145: simultaneous_signals_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1146:     simultaneous_signals_test(false, true).
 1147: 
 1148: simultaneous_signals_recv_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1149:     simultaneous_signals_test(true, true).

 1151: simultaneous_signals_test(RecvPairs, Exit) ->
 1152:     erlang:trace(new_processes, true, [running_procs]),
 1153:     persistent_term:put({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}, make_ref()),
 1154:     Literal = persistent_term:get({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
 1155:     true = is_reference(Literal),
 1156:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
 1157:     SFact = test_server:timetrap_scale_factor(),
 1158:     GoTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 1000*SFact,
 1159:     ProcF = fun () ->
 1160:                     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Literal), %% Should be a literal...
 1161:                     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1162:                     Tmo = case GoTime - Now of
 1163:                               Left when Left < 0 ->
 1164:                                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
 1165:                                   0;
 1166:                               Left ->
 1167:                                   Left
 1168:                           end,
 1169:                     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
 1170:                     on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1171:                     if RecvPairs -> receive_integer_pairs(0);
 1172:                        true -> ok
 1173:                     end,
 1174:                     receive check_literal_conversion -> ok end,
 1175:                     receive
 1176:                         Literal ->
 1177:                             %% Should not be a literal anymore...
 1178:                             false = (0 == erts_debug:size_shared(Literal))
 1179:                     end
 1180:             end,
 1181:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1182:                             spawn_opt(ProcF,
 1183:                                       [link,
 1184:                                        monitor,
 1185:                                        {message_queue_data, on_heap}])
 1186:                     end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 1187:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1188:                           lists:foreach(fun (N) when N rem 100 == 0 ->
 1189:                                                 P ! [N|N];
 1190:                                             (N) ->
 1191:                                                 P ! N
 1192:                                         end, lists:seq(1, 10000)),
 1193:                           P ! Literal
 1194:                   end, PMs),
 1195:     Now = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1196:     Tmo = case GoTime - Now - 5 of % a bit earlier...
 1197:               Left when Left < 0 ->
 1198:                   erlang:display({go_time_passed, Left}),
 1199:                   0;
 1200:               Left ->
 1201:                   Left
 1202:           end,
 1203:     receive after Tmo -> ok end,
 1204:     persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}),
 1205:     receive after 10 -> ok end,
 1206:     if Exit ->
 1207:             _ = lists:foldl(fun ({P, _M}, N) when N rem 10 ->
 1208:                                     unlink(P),
 1209:                                     exit(P, terminated),
 1210:                                     N+1;
 1211:                                 (_PM, N) ->
 1212:                                     N+1
 1213:                             end,
 1214:                             0,
 1215:                             PMs),
 1216:             ok;
 1217:        true ->
 1218:             ok
 1219:     end,
 1220:     wait_traced_not_running(1000 + 200*SFact),
 1221:     erlang:trace(new_processes, false, [running_procs]),
 1222:     literal_area_collector_test:check_idle(),
 1223:     lists:foreach(fun ({P,_M}) ->
 1224:                           P ! check_literal_conversion
 1225:                   end, PMs),
 1226:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1227:                           receive
 1228:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
 1229:                                   case R of
 1230:                                       normal -> ok;
 1231:                                       terminated -> ok
 1232:                                   end
 1233:                           end
 1234:                   end, PMs),
 1235:     ok.
 1236:     
 1237: 
 1238: wait_traced_not_running(Tmo) ->
 1239:     receive
 1240:         {trace,_,What,_} when What == in;
 1241:                               What == out ->
 1242:             wait_traced_not_running(Tmo)
 1243:     after
 1244:         Tmo ->
 1245:             ok
 1246:     end.
 1247: 
 1248: receive_integer_pairs(Tmo) ->
 1249:     receive
 1250:         [N|N] ->
 1251:             receive_integer_pairs(Tmo)
 1252:     after
 1253:         Tmo ->
 1254:             ok
 1255:     end.
 1256: 
 1257: parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1258:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 1259:     try
 1260:         lists:foreach(fun (_) -> parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1_test() end,
 1261:                       lists:seq(1, 5))
 1262:     after
 1263:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
 1264:     end.
 1265: 
 1266: parallel_signal_enqueue_race_1_test() ->
 1267:     %%
 1268:     %% PR-7822 (first commit)
 1269:     %%
 1270:     %% This bug could be triggered when
 1271:     %% * receiver had parallel signal enqueue optimization enabled
 1272:     %% * receiver fetched signals while it wasn't in a running state (only
 1273:     %%   happens when receive traced)
 1274:     %% * signals were enqueued simultaneously as the fetch of signals
 1275:     %%
 1276:     %% When the bug was triggered, the receiver could end up in an inconsistent
 1277:     %% state where it potentially would be stuck for ever.
 1278:     %%
 1279:     %% The above scenario is very hard to trigger, so the test typically do
 1280:     %% not fail even with the bug present, but we at least try to massage
 1281:     %% the scenario...
 1282:     R = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1283:                           true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers,
 1284:                                                                true),
 1285:                           receive after infinity -> ok end
 1286:                   end,
 1287:                   [{message_queue_data, off_heap}, {priority, high}, link]),
 1288:     T = spawn_link(fun FlushTrace () ->
 1289:                            receive {trace,R,'receive',_} -> ok end,
 1290:                            FlushTrace()
 1291:                    end),
 1292:     1 = erlang:trace(R, true, ['receive', {tracer, T}]),
 1293:     CountLoop = fun CountLoop (0) ->
 1294:                         ok;
 1295:                     CountLoop (N) ->
 1296:                         CountLoop(N-1)
 1297:                 end,
 1298:     SigLoop = fun SigLoop (0)  ->
 1299:                       ok;
 1300:                   SigLoop (N) ->
 1301:                       CountLoop(rand:uniform(4000)),
 1302:                       erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, R), [flush]),
 1303:                       receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1304:                       SigLoop(N-1)
 1305:               end,
 1306:     SMs = lists:map(fun (X) ->
 1307:                             spawn_opt(fun () -> SigLoop(1000) end,
 1308:                                       [{scheduler, X}, link, monitor])
 1309:                     end, lists:seq(1,erlang:system_info(schedulers_online))),
 1310:     R ! hello,
 1311:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1312:                           receive {'DOWN', M, process, P, _} -> ok end
 1313:                   end, SMs),
 1314: 
 1315:     %% These signals would typically not be delivered if the bug was
 1316:     %% triggered and the test case would time out.
 1317:     true = is_process_alive(R),
 1318:     unlink(R),
 1319:     exit(R, kill),
 1320:     false = is_process_alive(R),
 1321: 
 1322:     true = is_process_alive(T),
 1323:     unlink(T),
 1324:     exit(T, kill),
 1325:     false = is_process_alive(T),
 1326: 
 1327:     ok.
 1328: 
 1329: parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1330:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 1331:     try
 1332:         parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2_test()
 1333:     after
 1334:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
 1335:     end.
 1336: 
 1337: parallel_signal_enqueue_race_2_test() ->
 1338:     %%
 1339:     %% PR-7822 (first commit)
 1340:     %%
 1341:     %% This bug could be triggered when
 1342:     %% * A signal receiver process had the parallel signal enqueue optimization
 1343:     %%   enabled
 1344:     %% * Another process called process_info(Receiver, message_queue_len)
 1345:     %%   while the receiver was not executing and the process_info() call
 1346:     %%   internaly called erts_proc_sig_fetch() on receiver trying to
 1347:     %%   optimize the process_info() call
 1348:     %% * Yet another process simultaneously sent the receiver another
 1349:     %%   signal.
 1350:     %%
 1351:     %% When the bug was triggered, the receiver could end up in an inconsistent
 1352:     %% state where it potentially would be stuck for ever.
 1353:     %%
 1354:     %% The above scenario is very hard to trigger, so the test typically do
 1355:     %% not fail even with the bug present, but we at least try to massage
 1356:     %% the scenario...
 1357:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1358:     {RSched, PISched, LUSched} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1359:                                      1 ->
 1360:                                          {1, 1, 1};
 1361:                                      2 ->
 1362:                                          {2, 1, 2};
 1363:                                      3 ->
 1364:                                          {1, 2, 3};
 1365:                                      _ ->
 1366:                                          {2, 3, 4}
 1367:                                  end,
 1368:     Tester = self(),
 1369:     R = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1370:                           true = erts_debug:set_internal_state(proc_sig_buffers,
 1371:                                                                true),
 1372:                           Tester ! recv_ready,
 1373:                           receive after infinity -> ok end
 1374:                   end,
 1375:                   [{message_queue_data, off_heap}, link, {scheduler, RSched}]),
 1376: 
 1377:     PI = spawn_opt(fun PILoop () ->
 1378:                            true = is_process_alive(R),
 1379:                            Tester ! pi_ready,
 1380:                            receive go -> ok end,
 1381:                            _ = process_info(R, message_queue_len),
 1382:                            PILoop()
 1383:                    end,
 1384:                    [link, {scheduler, PISched}]),
 1385:     LU = spawn_opt(fun LULoop () ->
 1386:                            true = is_process_alive(R),
 1387:                            Tester ! lu_ready,
 1388:                            receive go -> ok end,
 1389:                            link(R),
 1390:                            unlink(R),
 1391:                            LULoop()
 1392:                    end,
 1393:                    [link, {scheduler, LUSched}]),
 1394: 
 1395:     receive recv_ready -> ok end,
 1396:     TriggerLoop = fun TriggerLoop(0) ->
 1397:                           ok;
 1398:                       TriggerLoop (N) ->
 1399:                           receive lu_ready -> ok end,
 1400:                           receive pi_ready -> ok end,
 1401:                           %% Give them some time to schedule out...
 1402:                           erlang:yield(),
 1403:                           case N rem 2 of
 1404:                               0 ->
 1405:                                   PI ! go,
 1406:                                   LU ! go;
 1407:                               1 ->
 1408:                                   LU ! go,
 1409:                                   PI ! go
 1410:                           end,
 1411:                           TriggerLoop(N-1)
 1412:                   end,
 1413:     TriggerLoop(400000),
 1414: 
 1415:     unlink(PI),
 1416:     exit(PI, kill),
 1417:     false = is_process_alive(PI),
 1418:     unlink(LU),
 1419:     exit(LU, kill),
 1420:     false = is_process_alive(LU),
 1421:     unlink(R),
 1422:     exit(R, kill),
 1423:     false = is_process_alive(R),
 1424:     ok.
 1425: 
 1426: dirty_schedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1427:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 1428:                           dirty_schedule_test()
 1429:                   end,
 1430:                   lists:seq(1, 5)),
 1431:     ok.
 1432: 
 1433: dirty_schedule_test() ->
 1434:     %%
 1435:     %% PR-7822 (second commit)
 1436:     %%
 1437:     %% This bug could occur when a process was to be scheduled due to an
 1438:     %% incomming signal just as the receiving process was selected for
 1439:     %% execution on a dirty scheduler. The process could then be inserted
 1440:     %% into a run-queue simultaneously as it began executing dirty. If
 1441:     %% the scheduled instance was selected for execution on one dirty
 1442:     %% scheduler simultaneously as it was scheduled out on another scheduler
 1443:     %% a race could cause the thread scheduling out the process to think it
 1444:     %% already was in the run-queue, so there is no need to insert it in the
 1445:     %% run-queue, while the other thread selecting it for execution dropped
 1446:     %% the process, since it was already running on another scheduler. By
 1447:     %% this the process ended up stuck in a runnable state, but not in the
 1448:     %% run-queue.
 1449:     %%
 1450:     %% When the bug was triggered, the receiver could end up in an inconsistent
 1451:     %% state where it potentially would be stuck for ever.
 1452:     %%
 1453:     %% The above scenario is very hard to trigger, so the test typically do
 1454:     %% not fail even with the bug present, but we at least try to massage
 1455:     %% the scenario...
 1456:     %%
 1457:     Proc = spawn_link(fun DirtyLoop () ->
 1458:                               erts_debug:dirty_io(scheduler,type),
 1459:                               DirtyLoop()
 1460:                       end),
 1461:     NoPs = lists:seq(1, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
 1462:     SpawnSender =
 1463:         fun (Prio) ->
 1464:                 spawn_opt(
 1465:                   fun () ->
 1466:                           Loop = fun Loop (0) ->
 1467:                                          ok;
 1468:                                      Loop (N) ->
 1469:                                          _ = process_info(Proc,
 1470:                                                           current_function),
 1471:                                          Loop(N-1)
 1472:                                  end,
 1473:                           receive go -> ok end,
 1474:                           Loop(100000)
 1475:                   end, [monitor,{priority,Prio}])
 1476:         end,
 1477:     Go = fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! go end,
 1478:     WaitProcs = fun ({P, M}) ->
 1479:                         receive {'DOWN', M, process, P, R} ->
 1480:                                 normal = R
 1481:                         end
 1482:                 end,
 1483:     PM1s = lists:map(fun (_) -> SpawnSender(normal) end, NoPs),
 1484:     lists:foreach(Go, PM1s),
 1485:     lists:foreach(WaitProcs, PM1s),
 1486:     PM2s = lists:map(fun (_) -> SpawnSender(high) end, NoPs),
 1487:     lists:foreach(Go, PM2s),
 1488:     lists:foreach(WaitProcs, PM2s),
 1489:     PM3s = lists:map(fun (N) ->
 1490:                              Prio = case N rem 2 of
 1491:                                         0 -> normal;
 1492:                                         1 -> high
 1493:                                     end,
 1494:                              SpawnSender(Prio) end, NoPs),
 1495:     lists:foreach(Go, PM3s),
 1496:     lists:foreach(WaitProcs, PM3s),
 1497:     unlink(Proc),
 1498:     exit(Proc, kill),
 1499:     false = is_process_alive(Proc),
 1500:     ok.
 1501: 
 1502: %%
 1503: %% -- Internal utils --------------------------------------------------------
 1504: %%
 1505: 
 1506: match(X,X) -> ok.
 1507: 
 1508: load_driver(Config, Driver) ->
 1509:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1510:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(DataDir, Driver) of
 1511:         ok ->
 1512:             ok;
 1513:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 1514:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 1515:             Res
 1516:     end.
 1517: 
 1518: wait_until(Fun) ->
 1519:     case (catch Fun()) of
 1520:         true ->
 1521:             ok;
 1522:         _ ->
 1523:             receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1524:             wait_until(Fun)
 1525:     end.
 1526: 
 1527: find_proc_link(Pid, To) when is_pid(Pid), is_pid(To) ->
 1528:     lists:keyfind(To,
 1529:                   #erl_link.pid,
 1530:                   erts_debug:get_internal_state({link_list, Pid})).
 1531: 
 1532: make_busy(OnNode, ToNode, Time) ->
 1533:     Parent = self(),
 1534:     Fun = fun () ->
 1535:                   Proxy = self(),
 1536:                   Sspndr = spawn_link(
 1537:                              ToNode,
 1538:                              fun () ->
 1539:                                      IC = find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(OnNode),
 1540:                                      erlang:suspend_process(IC),
 1541:                                      Proxy ! {self(), input_cntrlr_suspended},
 1542:                                      receive
 1543:                                          {Proxy, resume_input_cntrlr} ->
 1544:                                              erlang:resume_process(IC)
 1545:                                      end,
 1546:                                      Proxy ! {self(), input_cntrlr_resumed}
 1547:                              end),
 1548:                   receive
 1549:                       {Sspndr, input_cntrlr_suspended} ->
 1550:                           ok
 1551:                   end,
 1552:                   Spammer = spawn_link(
 1553:                               OnNode,
 1554:                               fun () ->
 1555:                                       spammed = spam(ToNode),
 1556:                                       Proxy ! {self(), channel_busy},
 1557:                                       receive
 1558:                                       after Time -> ok
 1559:                                       end,
 1560:                                       Proxy ! {self(), timeout}
 1561:                               end),
 1562:                   receive
 1563:                       {Spammer, channel_busy} ->
 1564:                           Parent ! {self(), channel_busy}
 1565:                   end,
 1566:                   receive
 1567:                       {Spammer, timeout} ->
 1568:                           Sspndr ! {self(), resume_input_cntrlr}
 1569:                   end,
 1570:                   receive
 1571:                       {Sspndr, input_cntrlr_resumed} ->
 1572:                           ok
 1573:                   end
 1574:           end,
 1575:     Proxy = spawn_link(Fun),
 1576:     receive
 1577:         {Proxy, channel_busy} ->
 1578:             ok
 1579:     end,
 1580:     Proxy.
 1581: 
 1582: find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
 1583:     case lists:keyfind(Node, 1, erlang:system_info(dist_ctrl)) of
 1584:         {Node, DistCtrl} ->
 1585:             find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(DistCtrl);
 1586:         false ->
 1587:             undefined
 1588:     end;
 1589: find_gen_tcp_input_cntrlr(DistCtrl) when is_pid(DistCtrl) ->
 1590:     {links, LList} = process_info(DistCtrl, links),
 1591:     try
 1592:         lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 1593:                               case process_info(Pid, initial_call) of
 1594:                                   {initial_call,
 1595:                                    {gen_tcp_dist,dist_cntrlr_input_setup,3}} ->
 1596:                                       throw({input_ctrlr, Pid});
 1597:                                   _ ->
 1598:                                       ok
 1599:                               end
 1600:                       end,
 1601:                       LList),
 1602:         undefined
 1603:     catch
 1604:         throw:{input_ctrlr, DistInputCtrlr} ->
 1605:             DistInputCtrlr
 1606:     end.
 1607: 
 1608: spam(Node) ->
 1609:     To = {'__a_name_hopefully_not_registered__', Node},
 1610:     Data = lists:seq(1, 100),
 1611:     spam(To, Data).
 1612: 
 1613: spam(To, Data) ->
 1614:     case erlang:send(To, Data, [nosuspend]) of
 1615:         nosuspend ->
 1616:             spammed;
 1617:         _ ->
 1618:             spam(To, Data)
 1619:     end.
 1620: 
 1621: repeat(_Fun, N) when is_integer(N), N =< 0 ->
 1622:     ok;
 1623: repeat(Fun, N) when is_function(Fun, 0), is_integer(N)  ->
 1624:     Fun(),
 1625:     repeat(Fun, N-1);
 1626: repeat(Fun, N) when is_function(Fun, 1), is_integer(N)  ->
 1627:     Fun(N),
 1628:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
 1629: 
 1630: busy_wait_until(Fun) ->
 1631:     case catch Fun() of
 1632:         true -> ok;
 1633:         _ -> busy_wait_until(Fun)
 1634:     end.
 1635: 
 1636: id(X) ->
 1637:     X.
 1638:
